name: D2. Up the Strip
statement:
You have a vertical strip with n cells, numbered consecutively from 1 to
n from top to bottom.You also have a token that is initially placed in
cell n. You will move the token up until it arrives at cell 1.Let the
token be in cell x > 1 at some moment. One shift of the token can have
either of the following kinds: Subtraction: you choose an integer y
between 1 and x-1, inclusive, and move the token from cell x to cell x -
y. Floored division: you choose an integer z between 2 and x, inclusive,
and move the token from cell x to cell
lfloor
frac{x}{z}
rfloor (x divided by z rounded down). Find the number of ways to move
the token from cell n to cell 1 using one or more shifts, and print it
modulo m. Note that if there are several ways to move the token from one
cell to another in one shift, all these ways are considered (check
example explanation for a better understanding).
